alert.note: Alert for Maricopa; Pinal (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued June 23 at 2:45PM MST until June 23 at 3:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A DUST STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 345 PM MST FOR MARICOPA AND PINAL COUNTIES... At 244 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 12 miles west of Chui-Chu to near Arizola to 11 miles east of Florence, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Less than one quarter mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 10 between mile markers 173 and 204. AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 160 and 178. US Highway 60 between mile markers 210 and 216. Locations impacted include... Casa Grande, Florence, Coolidge, Maricopa, Queen Creek, Arizona City, La Palma, Blackwater, Toltec, Magma, San Tan Valley, Coolidge Airport, Florence Junction, Bapchule and Olberg. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, then pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
